title: Charges dropped against ex-Brookline teacher accused of raping student after alleged victim declines to testify
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Crime Larry Chen was expected to stand trial this week on a slew of charges in connection with his alleged assault on a former Brookline student.
Larry Chen taught at the Heath School from 2013 to 2018.

Brookline Police Department By Abby Patkin September 26, 2025 | 12:25 PM 2 minutes to read Norfolk County prosecutors have dropped their case against a former Brookline teacher accused of sexually abusing an underage student, citing the alleged victim’s unwillingness to testify.

title: Two BPD officers injured in South End crash
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Local News The cause of the crash remains under investigation.
By Beth Treffeisen September 26, 2025 | 12:24 PM Less than a minute to read ShareSend this article to your social connections.
An early morning crash in Boston’s South End on Friday seriously injured two police officers, according to the Boston Police Department.

title: Starbucks is closing Government Center’s iconic steaming kettle location
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Business The company says the closure is part of a broader restructuring plan that targets "Grab & Go” locations and underperforming stores.
The steaming kettle adorns the Starbucks location set to close on Sunday.
Kelly Chan/Boston.

title: Tell us: What are you reading this fall?
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Tell Us Whatever’s on your nightstand, we want to hear about it.
Monet Gagnon read a book in the Public Garden on a bed of fallen leaves.

(Suzanne Kreiter/Globe staff) By Annie Jonas September 26, 2025 | 10:35 AM 1 minute to read Crisp air, shorter days, and the return of sweater weather can only mean one thing — it’s the perfect season to curl up with a great book.

title: Are condos finally becoming more available — and less expensive — in Mass.?
